channel.title: 🪴 Fin's Garden on
channel.description: Recent content in 🪴 Fin's Garden on

item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!

saturday (-2) Morning bagged and condensed plastic bags took out recycling loaded dishwasher cleaned trash off counters ties, tops, packets, rips lotsa mold esp counter strawberries wiped counters and sink lotsa gross sink had pimento bits cleaned off stairs swept stairs put away towels picked up dirty laundry ran wash - towels fed cat
github pages

Todo Commit daily Yellow Pages LDAP auth UT admissions stuff submit GRE submit Transcripts contact Dr B Write statement of purpose Update Resume Finish Thin Sections Get Carrie to upload rest of them Get photos from Liz Clean up code pick a static site generator and write about it start using checks and build up something work on reading list copy over from obsidian - keyboard, &c test getting out of foam + next.

item.title: CJK + Latex Support (测试)
item.description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean Support 几乎在我们意识到之前，我们已经离开了地面。 우리가 그것을 알기도 전에 우리는 땅을 떠났습니다. 私たちがそれを知るほぼ前に、私たちは地面を離れていました。 Latex Block math works with two dollar signs $$.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Daily note for 2022-07-05
item.description: Daily note for 2022-07-05 Work ToDos and UT application Let’s try to make it into work for the morning meditation Bring both laptops and copy tools/kbd layout Getting a bit tired of reading fiction, but also kinda want to finish reading Gibson Data Structures on the brain

item.title: Daily note for 2022-07-06
item.description: Daily note for 2022-07-06 A new day, a new note. Woo! Today Kate’s getting her implant, so it’s going to be a short day at work for me.

item.title: How does your garden grow?
item.description: It’s still early days in both using a personal knowledge management system and publishing it to the web, so all of this might change, and most of it will need fleshed out.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: “[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Reading List 2022
item.description: books Essential Alan Watts Atomic Habits - James Clear Mathematics of Human Flourishing - Francis Su Atlas of the Heart - Brene Brown Count Zero - William Gibson Neuromancer - William Gibson Agency - William Gibson The Peripheral - William Gibson Zero History - William Gibson Spook Country - William Gibson Pattern Recognition - William Gibson The Satanic Bible - Anton LeVay Zen Mind, Beginners Mind - Shunryu Suzuki Little, Big - John Crowley Sutta Pitaka - Bhikku Thanissaro The Happiness Hack - Ellen Leanse The Silk Roads - Peter Frankopan Lord Valentine’s Castle - Robert Silverberg The Ministry for the Future - Kim Robinson Thinking, Fast and Slow - Daniel Kahneman Reconcilliation - Thich Nhat Hanh The Tibetan Book of Living and Dying - Sogyal Rinpoche Anger - Thich Nhat Hanh Smilla’s Sense of Snow - Peter Hoeg Chapterhouse Dune - Frank Herbert Heretics of Dune - Frank Herbert Four Thousand Weeks - Oliver Burkeman God Emperor of Dune - Frank Herbert Fierce Self-Compassion - Kristin Neff audiobooks Four Agreements - Don Miguel Ruiz Four Times Per Year Atomic Habits - James Clear essays vannevar bush - As We May Think The Garden and The Stream: a Technopastoral David Foster Wallace - This Is Water

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard If you want to see your own on here, submit a Pull Request adding yourself to this file!

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!
